_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Five qualities of a resident mendicant t: They're restrained in the code of conduct
They have good behavior and supporters
They see danger in the slightest fault and keep the rules they've undertaken
They're very learned, remembering and keeping what they've learned
Teachings that the resident mendicant is: These teachings are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end
They describe a spiritual practice that's totally full and pure
The resident mendicant is very learned in such teachings, remembering them, reciting them, mentally scrutinizing them, and comprehending them theoretically
Tasks performed by the resident mendican: They repair what is decayed and damaged
They go to the lay people and announce the arrival of a large mendicant Saá¹…gha with mendicants from abroad, encouraging them to make merit
Abilities of the resident mendicant [an5: They can get the four absorptions - blissful meditations in the present life that belong to the higher mind - when they want, without trouble or difficulty.
